semantical

Class TypeChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • semantical.TypeChecker

  • public class TypeChecker
extends java.lang.Object
    A type-checker. It maintains a symbol table and auxiliary information needed to type-check Kitten source code.
    Author:
    Fausto Spoto

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TypeChecker(Type returnType, ErrorMsg errorMsg)
      Constructs a type-checker having a given expected return type, a given error reporting utility, an empty symbol table and that has not seen any variable up to now.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean anyErrors()
      Determines if any error has been reported up to now
      void error(int pos, java.lang.String msg)
      Reports an error through this type-checker.
      Type getReturnType()
      Yields the type expected by this type-checker for the return commands.
      Type getVar(java.lang.String var)
      Yields the type bound to a given variable in this type-checker.
      int getVarNum(java.lang.String var)
      Yields the progressive number assigned to a given variable by this type-checker.
      TypeChecker putVar(java.lang.String var, Type type)
      Yields a new type-checker identical to this but where a given variable has been bound to a given type.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TypeChecker

        public TypeChecker(Type returnType,
                   ErrorMsg errorMsg)
        Constructs a type-checker having a given expected return type, a given error reporting utility, an empty symbol table and that has not seen any variable up to now.
        Parameters:
        returnType - the expected return type
        errorMsg - the error reporting utility used to signal errors

    • Method Detail

      • getReturnType

        public Type getReturnType()
        Yields the type expected by this type-checker for the return commands.
        Returns:
        the type expected by this type-checker for the return commands

      • putVar

        public TypeChecker putVar(java.lang.String var,
                          Type type)
        Yields a new type-checker identical to this but where a given variable has been bound to a given type.
        Parameters:
        var - the variable to be bound
        type - the type to which var must be bound
        Returns:
        the new type-checker where var is bound to type

      • getVar

        public Type getVar(java.lang.String var)
        Yields the type bound to a given variable in this type-checker.
        Parameters:
        var - the variable
        Returns:
        the type bound to var in this type-checker. Yields null if var is not bound in this type-checker

      • getVarNum

        public int getVarNum(java.lang.String var)
        Yields the progressive number assigned to a given variable by this type-checker.
        Parameters:
        var - the variable
        Returns:
        the progressive number of var in some enumeration of the variables seen so far by this type-checker. It is guaranteed that progressive numbers are non-negative and that two distinct variables have distinct progressive numbers. Yields -1 if var is not bound in this type-checker

      • error

        public void error(int pos,
                  java.lang.String msg)
        Reports an error through this type-checker.
        Parameters:
        pos - the position where the error must be reported (number of characters from the beginning of the source file)
        msg - the message to be reported

      • anyErrors

        public boolean anyErrors()
        Determines if any error has been reported up to now
        Returns:
        true if some error has been reported up to now, false otherwise
